page.title: 19THE DOUGLAS MACMILLAN HOME
page.content: The Health authority gives 260 pounds for each of the 15 beds, weekly. The money for the other beds is raised in the community. Some money is raised when that people die do not have flowers at the funeral, but have donations sent to the home. People do not only go into the home when they are dying, but also for pain control. The cancer is not actually treated at the home but sometimes chemo therapy is given. The home does not just help the patient it helps the patient's family to understand. Even if the patient dies the family are still helped by the home. Not everyone dies from cancer, some can live with it. When the patients go home a day care nurse visits them 2 or 3 times a week. The patients come from all over North Staffs,and are refered to the home by doctors.It is not a depressing place.
